outputs.output_descr: In Kalimantan, oil palm plantations cover at least 3.56 million ha, having expanded nearly 300 percent since 2000. Within the HoB landscape, there are 1.6 million ha of palm oil concessions, including at least 830,000 ha of active and/or newly allocated concessions in Kalimantan, with recent allocations concentrated in West and East Kalimantan. It is estimated that, compared with a 2013 baseline, the full development of allocated palm oil leases would, by 2020, convert a further 9.4 million ha to plantations; an estimated 90% of this area would consist of forested lands, including 41% intact f

document_name: RFQ/UNDP/EU/KALFOR/38796/008/2018 - ICT Equipment for Kalimantan Forest Planning Project READVERTISEMENT
